channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There is no street lighting on Farm Lane between Brizen Lane and Meadowsweet Road., 6th January
item.description:
Pitch black stretch of pavement used by pupils of Leckhampton High School. A scary place to walk after dark despite being near to hundreds of houses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding, 6th January
item.description:
This drain has been blocked with decaying leaves for weeks and creates a significantly large collection of water which takes days to disappear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Well Place, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boulders, large stones, silt causing an obstruction, 6th January
item.description:
The gravel build up has amassed over the past few months and each precipitation event causes a further build up. Road markings no longer visible. Dangerous to all road users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains both sides of Victoria Street, 6th January
item.description:
The drain is blocked outside number 24 and the drain on the opposite side of the road is also blocked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Victoria Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flooding due to broken/blocked drain, 6th January
item.description:
Cowley to Cockleford Road, constant flooding, impassable water depth with a broken drain cover and silted up outflow pipe. Flooding is a daily/weekly occurrence
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley Lane, Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low overhanging bush/tree over path, 6th January
item.description:
Headed towards Leckhampton on the left hand side just after the chicane and where the path commences slightly uphill on the grass embankment there is a fir tree/large bush overhanging the path. The overhanging branches are low, I've not measured them but suspect that if you are over 5ft 10ins you will have to stoop to get under them. This has been like this for a number of years now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Lane is considerably damaged, 6th January
item.description:
Just up from The Mill, Mill Lane Water is pouring onto the lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Mill Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple holes which are hard to drive over, 6th January
item.description:
Between the train station and the traffic lights near Alstone. If you drive down the road it is like a farm track.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 154, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 6th January
item.description:
As you are headed towards Leckghampton on the left hand side on the road just after Hatherley Brook this is a drain with cover that is blocked, it has been like this for some time. When it rains hard it normally floods.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: National speed limit signs, 6th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked Drain....Again, 6th January
item.description:
This drain gets blocked. It causes significant issues for the hospice and visitors to the hospice
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 6th January
item.description:
NWD WITH GIVE AND TAKE PLUS 15 MINUTES DELAY BOARDS NEEDED CARRIAGE WAY POTHOLE 600X400X70MM TARMAC PATCH REQUIRED SIZE IS APPROPRIATELY NO PHOTOS UNABLE TO STOP AN MARK UP BEST OUT OF SCHOOL HOURS (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 6th January
item.description:
Extensive fly tipping outside former sub station
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Hesters Way Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water running off hill due to blocked culvert, 6th January
item.description:
Water is continually running down the footpath between 35 & 37 Collum End Rise and then down the road. There is a stream running under this area that was culverted when the houses were built (c,#. 1965) or even earlier - it is clearly blocked. The continual flow of water is the main reason for the potholes identified outside nos. 29 and 40 Collum End Rise. Problem has been evident for months, except when there has been a prolonged spell of dry weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Collum End Rise, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lorry has gone over and indented the pavement causing a major hazard, 6th January
item.description:
Corner of Cowper Road off Pitman Road the pavement has been indented by a lorry causing a very dangerous trip hazard. The lorry has also damaged pavement outside 9 Cowper Road. This was when the council were having work done on the flats and regular lorryâ€™s coming down the road mounting the kerbs after loading up with rubble.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51;53, Pitman Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Honeybourne line flooding, 6th January
item.description:
Flooding happens regularly underneath rail bridge on honeybounre line. Has previously been reported but no changes made. Unable to walk underneath having to walk on muddy verge beside which has caused people to fall over. Needs addressing asap before somebody falls and seriously hurts themselves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
